io.appium.java_client

Class TouchAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.appium.java_client.TouchAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PerformsActions<TouchAction>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IOSTouchAction

    public class TouchAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements PerformsActions<TouchAction>
    Used for Webdriver 3 touch actions See the Webriver 3 spec https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/webdriver/raw-file/default/webdriver-spec.html The flow is to chain individual touch actions into an entire gesture. e.g. TouchAction action = new TouchAction(performsTouchActions); action.press(element).waitAction(300).moveTo(element1).release().perform(); Calling perform() sends the action command to the Mobile Driver. Otherwise, more and more actions can be chained.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  TouchAction.ActionParameter
      Just holds values to eventually return the parameters required for the mjsonwp.

      • moveTo

        public TouchAction moveTo(int x,
                          int y)
        Move current touch to a new position relative to the current position on the screen. If the current position of this TouchAction is (xOld, yOld), then this method will move the TouchAction to (xOld + x, yOld + y).
        Parameters:
        x - change in x coordinate to move through.
        y - change in y coordinate to move through.
        Returns:
        this TouchAction, for chaining.
